intro: Discocalyx subsinuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf discocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
